boone.map

Class Topology

  • java.lang.Object
    • boone.map.Topology
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Storable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HexagonTopology

    public abstract class Topology
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, Storable
    The topology defines the neighborhood relation of the output neurons so as to form a map of neurons.
    Author:
    Helmut A. Mayer

      • clone

        public Topology clone()
        A clone keeping the reference to the same network and the same neighbor list.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a clone, null if problems which are very unlikely

      • getNet

        Returns:
        a neural network

      • setNet

        public void setNet(NeuralNet net)
        Sets the associated net.
        Parameters:
        net - a net

      • getNeighbors

        public java.util.List<Neuron> getNeighbors(Neuron neuron,
                                           int radius)
        Returns all neighbors within a given 'radius' of the given neuron. For efficiency subsequent calls with identical parameters immediately return the last result. For this to work the returned list of neurons must not be changed! The given start neuron will always be in the neighbor list (also for negative radius).
        Parameters:
        neuron - a neuron
        radius - the neighborhood radius
        Returns:
        a list of neighbor neurons

      • arrangeNeurons

        public abstract boolean arrangeNeurons()
        Arranges the output neurons of the net according to the topology.
        Returns:
        true, if arranged, false, if problems

      • addNeighbor

        protected void addNeighbor(int id)
        Adds a neighbor to the neighbor list.
        Parameters:
        id - the neuron index

      • getNeurons

        public abstract int[] getNeurons()
        Returns the dimensions of the map.
        Returns:
        the number of map neurons per dimension

      • getSizes

        public abstract double[] getSizes()
        Returns the size (length) of each dimension of the map.
        Returns:
        the length of each dimension

      • setMapValue

        protected abstract void setMapValue(int index,
                                    int value)
        Sets the map at the given neuron index to value.
        Parameters:

        value - the map value
